intro: Wulfenia orientalis var. glanduligera, commonly known as the glandular wulfenia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually opposite, narrow, and covered with glandular hairs, which contribute to its distinctive appearance. The flowers, which are usually blue or purple, bloom in late spring to early summer.
